rYvCVtArTDNpU8GzTCcqbQ.text: I'm sad to have to say this, but I went back a couple weeks ago and the food was not good like i remembered.  The rice was dry, and the main dishes were mostly sauce with like 6 small pieces of meat per bowl.  Definitely not enough for three people to share two dishes.  The only good thing was that they give 20% off at lunchtime.....but maybe they gave us 20% less food to make up for the discount. :(Time to find another place, i guess.

Sab-RHJXbFpWLCyxMgJoAA.text: We stayed right around the corner from this place.  I thought that it was the best Indian food that I ever had and I eat Indian food all of the time.  My wife and I loved it.  We enjoyed it so much that we ate there two days in a row.  We loved the pappadums.  The apple chutney was my favorite.  We had the tandoori mix and everything was excellent.  We also had chicken tikka masala.  We came there with our two year old and the steward was great with her.  I strongly recommend this place and if you get there before 6:30 you get 20% off.

xpLjzEJX-W3ZimyRRtLzXQ.text: I'm not sure I would qualify as an Indian food aficianado but I think we clearly had a much better experience than the other reviewers.  We stayed in the South Kensington area and thought we'd check out this place one night for dinner.  We had a good experience here.  The food that was expected to be spicy was and all of it was tasy - we did the dining for two so we had the chance to try a bit of everything...which was a ton of food.  We had good service - although it was interesting that ALL questions were directed towards my hubby and not me...oh well, cultural differences aside, I liked this place a lot.

KK60ON-7_CAtobsYTHiZ4Q.text: We had a large and hungry family spilling out of the museums for lunch and looking for somewhere to seat 9 at short notice. Unsurprisingly, the few places not completely full didn't have space for all of us. We hesitated over khans for a minute or two because it was half empty, but hunger took us in. It was a good choice - the service was friendly and fast and the food good if not excellent and the price reasonable. In particular, bearing in mind what others have said, there was plenty of variety and depth in the flavours, and heat in the appropriate dishes. It filled up pretty quickly after we sat down and we would definitely go back.

dQLR1GegmNQahlnSqvhlKQ.text: I hate writing negative reviews when the service is good but I have to say something. When you have reviews from non Indians complaining about how bland the food is at an Indian restaurant, pay attention. I wish I had checked yelp before eating here and partaking in one of the worst meals I had in London. At first I tried to excuse it and said maybe it's made for the palate of Londoners or people who don't know Indian food, but then I checked the reviews here and I saw a general consensus. Alarm bells should have gone off when I ordered chicken biryani and the waiter suggested I order a curry sauce to go with it because the biryani is "very dry." What? Since when does biryani need curry sauce on it. I let it go because I've seen some Bengali friends put curry on their biryani. When I got my food and tasted it, I realized that to the waiter "very dry" apparently means bland and tasteless. No kidding, it tasted like plain rice. My mother got chicken tikka masala and even this hard to screw up dish tasted terrible. Seriously, the first time I tried making chicken tikka masala, it tasted better than theirs. We found a spicy flavorful chutney on the table, that we just dumped on everything to improve the flavor because we were starving and not many places were open. The waiters even noticed we didn't like the food and kept asking if everything was okay. I'm sorry, they were really nice and the service was good, but the food was tragic. The only thing that actually tasted good was the garlic naan. Please please invest in a copy of Madhur Jaffery's Indian Cooking or any of Julie Sahni's recipe books. If someone tried Indian food here for the first time, they'd probably never eat it again. That makes me sad.

ByOlMJi8_OeECj8RONyIQA.text: Very good restaurant. Everything is really good, many dishes just delicious!Good service. No compaints. Not cheap, but well worth the price.Its also easy to reach by many buses and South Ken station is almost opposite.Recommended by a few guide books.

3z2L3ZPnUCtAUhlf6xzEgg.text: Had lunch at Khan's yesterday, here are my thoughts:Ambiance: just okay. The restaurant was empty when we arrived for lunch at 2pm. The fact there was no music was odd, it was a QUIET lunch.Service: just one server and he was friendly and accommodating of the fact we were in a bit of a rush. Food came out quickly, this may be because we ordered items that wouldn't take a while.Food: -- Samosas were good.-- Avocado shrimp was terrible - avoid this appetizer.-- Rice was a bit dry.-- Daal had good flavor but was watery.-- Okra was a bit bitter but wasn't greasy, which is a plus.-- Papadums were tasty (note these aren't complimentary!)Overall: Khan's was just okay...we won't be returning.

Z5AasWfAroUTr0F44z11iQ.text: Stayed in hotel across the street came for dinner and we did not want to leave. BEST lamb chops I ever had.. all other dish were great no complaints!! If you're in the area this is a must try, it's your lost if you don't.

tFByUtvnsCD9vRrOUt0i-w.text: We had high hopes for this restaurant.  It seemed to get pretty good reviews, and we'd heard good things about the Indian cuisine in this neighborhood.  Unfortunately everything we had was pretty bland and uninspiring.  My wife doesn't care for spice, so we stuck with milder dishes like the Murg (Chicken) Tikka Masala and the Kashmiri Palak Paneer.  In my experience, mild heat doesn't mean bland and boring.  Mild Indian dishes can still be fresh, vibrant and interesting.  Unfortunately the food here was entirely forgettable.  The chutneys were muted and one-dimensional.  The stir fried calamari appetizer was overcooked, and the mains were just OK.  The service wasn't particularly great.  Not bad, but on the slow side.  We were seated at a table in a corner upstairs, which was stuffy and cramped.  None of these would detract from the experience if the food were transcendent.  It just isn't.

Ip8hS6vWQS1-DKLbcT7r_A.text: We had a wonderful meal at Khans, our first night in London. The wait staff were friendly, accommodating and took care of all our needs. The food was amazing, we had the Kashmiri Lamb Korma, Murg Korma and Aloo Gobi. All cooked to perfection. When we return to London we will also return to Khans.

GLqXV4iTlZbIzZ729HikEQ.text: Mutter paneer, naan and chicken tikka masala good. I did not like the coriander chutney and service was just okay. Chairs comfortable and setting nice.

m55e5rD3KpQ07oFBNcAV4w.text: Awesome Dinner place in South Kensington! The staff was nice and the environment for dinner was nice! There was an abundance of delicious food!

NQJx6-CkCjJQxpo0nHBbjg.text: Was looking for a reasonable Indian restaurant for a family meal and this was perfect--stopped here last night of our trip.  Staff was very friendly and helpful and food was delicious.  Lamp chops in particular quite good.

VnRGEl7fgV0gQ2ljaaiaaQ.text: Fantastic Indian food that this visitor from Las Vegas will return for on every annual pilgrimage to London.

eD4Bq-KqehPE8wdSLfGwow.text: Great Indian cuisine at a reasonable price. Perfect for a quick meal after a nearby museum visit.

_Y1pG3Ppi-eG-uI-CFnzUg.text: My wife and I experienced Khan's on a recent honeymoon to London.  I think that it should have a higher rating than 3 stars based on our experience.  It helped that it was before dinner hours so the entire meal was 20% off.  We really enjoyed the Murg Tikka Massala and the vegetarian meal for one.  I liked the combo platter because it gave us a variety of the Indian flavors and of course includes naan bread.  I also loved the tikka massala as the charcoal grilled chicken pieces were super flavorful and juicy.  With the discount we ended up spending about 30 GPB, which isn't bad for London and we were both very full.

6lpQ5kxbh444QAiIiIQ0sg.text: A native Londoner, recommended this as a good and not overly expensive option for Indian food. We were impressed by the variety that came with their combinations and liked pretty much everything we had. The service was friendly and pretty fast. We went before 6:00 and got 20% off our bill!

WJswaVAfMBA_K7jHWk1yrw.text: amazing meal and great service! Lovely lovely waiters and the best lamb chops and cheese naan I have ever had!

VsMcGsBSCUsw8GfnZGNziA.text: Underrated, great tikka masala, great service with a caring staff. They also give you a warm towel cloth at the end of the meal. Reasonable price too

n6ldCITzBFjV2oLNxAPHug.text: This place deserves a higher rating!  We had walked by earlier in the day and said we'd come back for dinner if we were nearby, and we just happened to be!  We were greeted warmly and shown to a table and immediately given poppadum with chutneys.The staff was VERY attentive - it seemed we had four or five different people paying attention to us.  My only complaint about this was the man who was acting as host made me feel a little uncomfortable asking how things were, was I being well taken care of, etc... a few times.Anyway -- we enjoyed everything immensely.  Onion bhajis were good but not quite as expected as they were flat and not crunchy enough, but the flavor was great.  We also had Peshwari naan, Chicken Tikka Masala, Lamb Rogan Josh and Aloo Gobi.  Everything was to die for and I would happily recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious Indian meal and great service.

ta-jP86CKey8MFpMfNuoaA.text: Why was the chicken tikka masala sweet?!? Service was ok. At least the garlic naan was good.

UTXDmmrzLFV3ybqDGC-mKA.text: Nice service,you get a lot of attention from the waiters.You get the traditional free pappadums while you order, with exquisite chutney and raita.Rice is nice, not overcooked, and Naan (cheese naan at least) is tasty.The main dishes are rather small, with a few pieces of grossly cut meat (not the nice diced chicked & lamb you usually get...).The sauce is still tasty, and blends really well with the side dishes.Overall a good restaurant for the price you pay, yet not the best indian food ever.

zAW7c4NBEpnTM6oVMs4Kkw.text: This place is awesome...... If you want to eat Indian food that tastes like water.If you prefer your Indian food to actually taste like something, go elsewhere. Literally, anywhere will be better.Thank you Khan's for earning the prize of being the Worst Indian Food I've Eaten In England.

GCCIEf6eI9hG3Y9j60gcjg.text: Great garlic naan.  Curries could have a bit more heat but they were very tasty.We did take-away but did experience the attentive staff.  Dishes were packaged to take out and were still hot after the tube ride home.

u8GwBN83XCg4IUClFiUOOg.text: Awful.The food lacked flavor and was watery or over oily.  Just flat out bad/disappointing.  The only thing I can imagine is that I got white boy Indian food....There was a very nice Indian couple sitting on the other side of us that looked to be really enjoying their meal.... I was surprised by both their presence and pleasure.The service was nice and the interior was very well maintained.... but you don't go for curry for these reasons.

OHn69YK231UEjmmdUKmx1g.text: They now charge 1.5£ per person for a thin pappadum they force on ya. Not worth it. Some of the appetizers were a clear miss, and the waiters were clearly trying to push more food on ya... Just didn't get a good vibe from this place. But the food was overall ok.

fapuPEfTcnQA-gdmlmujOA.text: Simple, quick and delicious. Lunch prices were very reasonable. Easy to find and right next to the tube station and museums.

vAry9oZQf39xsk2wOk9QNw.text: The restaurant is decorated in an oddly upscale but casual way. The menu is a good selection but is not overwhelming. The food is reasonably priced but you will need to order sides since they are not very big. The restaurant its self is not very large.

photos.caption: Photo of Khan's Of Kensington - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Khan's Of Kensington - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Khan's Of Kensington - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

qBofIKZTMI7fy3z2YCSF3A.text: No. This was not good Indian food, but was maybe what they think white people can tolerate or what they think tourists would like. Bland and creamy with no flavor. Hubby said his was okay, and the kiddos were underwhelmed. Very overpriced, but maybe the rent is high in the location?The waiters were quite kind and attentive and provided great service, especially since I was having some troubles. They even reheated the food (thus the two stars.)

0NkBFCbSFYEiiBa4BvsUvw.text: If you come to London, you should go to the Khan's of Kensington. They have the top best selection of Indian food. My family and I loved it and so will you! We got chicken Tandoori, bengan (eggplant), and for the appetizer we got papari chat. Absolutely delicious!!!!! If they had six stars I would give them six

QSURwl0prRmS_gh-OAVmmg.text: Khans is a small Indian restaurant in Kensington. Not too many items on the menu, but everything we had was great! The service was difficult: we were welcomed by a rather peculiar waiter that didn't speak much, and then had another one who was really warm& welcoming. The food was great, but there is not so much space and we were somewhat crumpled on a corner.

photos.caption: Photo of Khan's Of Kensington - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan, chicken tikka massala and green chicken curry at Khan's.

qOGDWDgQsOeEsHnf9FiuOw.text: This has been the best Indian food I've had in UK. The server and chef did a top notch job on making sure I wanted to linger eating their menu. I mentioned I'm used to spicy Indian food and they totally delivered.  Comfortable seating and pleasant restrooms. Thank you for your hospitality.

photos.caption: Photo of Khan's Of Kensington - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

CHTmo9A8_HZgqz-yxQXsqA.text: Do NOT go here unless you want terrible service. This place doesn't even deserve 1 star. Food was average and service was atrocious. The waiter was incredibly rude and problematic. He first off got the orders wrong and then refused to admit he got the orders wrong and that it was our fault for not getting the correct order. He then was very confrontational when answering questions about the check and did not want to give us a receipt. Each person also MUST buy a "main dish" here in order to avoid a £15 minimum charge per person. Apparently two appetizers don't qualify as a "main dish" but a £3 side salad does. There also is a 10% service charge already billed, regardless of how many people in your party, so the waiters can guarantee themselves a tip even though they are rude and bad at their jobs. Overall horrific experience and a complete waste of money.

vwalgXwx4ivHxYm-EtrS9w.text: I came in here after a trip to the Gingerbread City at Museum of Architecture. I was hesitant at first because of other reviews but I am happy i gave it a try. My sister and I ordered the delux platter for two. Food was delicious. I can't pick a favorite because they were all good. The chutneys were fresh. And the best part  was the friendly and attentive service. I highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Khan's Of Kensington - South Kensington, London, United Kingdom

jjdBNu1DXQ2mplO3WReA3g.text: Excellent cuisine, warm and humble service; will definitely come back for this experience again.

k04dZ6f_DM2YltODD9aKgg.text: The most amazing and traditional Indian food that you will ever have in London. The restaurant is on the brink of semi formal so definitely don't come in flip flops. The staff is amazingly helpful and being vegetarian there was plenty of options. The mushroom masala is to die for the mushrooms are seasoned perfect and if you get the garlic naan bread you'll be able to dip it and enjoy all the flavorful sauces. It's great for a date night or a night out with friends which we were there for and the host was so hospitable and everyone checked on it. Bottles of wines are perfectly prices especially compared to the neighborhood so you can enjoy a bottle of wine with your meal. It's a must stop in for traditional Indian food in London

AptLP-fUcCjpkX7XzhXvpA.text: Great India place right off our south Kensington tube station.  Good food with great flavors and combination.  I had the prawns masala and chicken booti one night and then the chicken Saak and chicken booti the next night.  Overall great experiences at a good price.

_dD_LPETi695EGodCUifYw.text: First experience at this place was good. But was with 2 other colleagues and it was a good experience. Came back 3 times afterwards and was turned away because it was table for 1. Last straw was clearly there was 3 tables open. Waiter asked how many? I said 1. Indian Lady behind me said 4 people. And he turned me away and said there's no table for you. Not sure if it was because I am not Indian? Or because they didn't want to waste a table on me. Or both.

cs8vObe7wZsXYfMpE1EJWg.text: We walked in off the street hoping for good London Indian food; instead, we had a distinctly unpleasant experience.Rude and inattentive waitstaff delayed our seating, spoke brusquely, and failed to give adequate refills on our water glasses. More relevantly, the completely misheard our order and left off significant amounts of food. When we asked where the rest of it was, they told us that we had everything; when we clarified, they then reversed course, lied, and claimed it was on its way. Needless to say, they had to cook it from scratch, making my wife wait for her food for a full twenty minutes after I had already finished mine.The food itself was mediocre. The chicken korma was bland with stringy meat; the vegetable curry was over spiced; and the masala mushrooms were boring. The rice and naan were good, at least, but they weren't a meal by themselves.Will not return, recommend avoiding.

wJ1vbNurkMK2V_VbRcF9tw.text: We loved this place!! The service is very good and the food tasted amazing, and all of this at a very reasonable price in a great area of London.My family is visiting London on vacation and wanted to have dinner in the area near the Natural History museum. We walked around, found Khan's of Kensington and since we wanted to have Indian food while in London we decided to give it a try. The servers are very helpful and attentive and our kids (13 and 15) loved the food. We highly recommend Khan and enjoying the neighborhood.

fXlQiuzldRYK9TIrBwldIQ.text: This restaurant is just my style and I'd recommend it to anyone - family, tourist, local, etc. The food is on point. Perfect Indian food suitable for any occasion. The masala, naan, and apps were all amazing. I'll definitely be coming back next time I'm in London.

J4hq0eNC3QE7q-QwdhJCiQ.text: Food was amazing and the staff was extremely attentive and helpful. Would definitely definitely come back here ! Their saag is soooooooo good!

B140HQPsWKSymPTKW6_p9Q.text: A delicious meal all around!  Visiting from the United States, this was exactly what I had expected from a Kensington area Indian restaurant. The portions were generous, the service was quick and friendly, and the flavors... mmmmmmm the flavors were awesome!Also worth noting that we went in as two babies and three adults, much to the dismay of other diners!  But the manager took the opposite approach and welcomed us with open arms.  We chatted and he sized us up and pretty much ordered on our behalf, and he couldn't have done a better job.  And when I said it wasn't spicy enough, he took the challenge to heart and brought me exactly what I needed!Will definitely be going back before I head home.

7B2kxumBkIBsqTXrOfVvfg.text: This may have been the best chicken tikki masala I've ever had. The chicken was cooked perfectly and the sauce was sweet, spicy and savory. I also had the cheese naan and jasmine basmati rice, which didn't disappoint. My wife had the murg olivier which was also amazing. The price was a complete shock...in a good way! Good luck finding Indian food that is this amazing at these prices.

5Q009JDalN0-HIWp843Xbw.text: Excellent food for a decent price. It's location right across the street from our South Kensington hotel is what got us through the door the first time, but the food and service is what got us back in a second time. If you love Indian food this is a great place to eat. All your Indian favorites can be found on the menu. The only down side is that the restaurant is fairly small, so if it is a busy night, or you have a larger group you may want to make reservations.

E_qcrdi8k2LYQW097RE19g.text: Food arrived an hour late.  It was cold and had been sitting at the restaurant for Uber Eats to pickup. They use Uber Eats for delivery which has been unreliable. I recommend dine in or take Out. Do not order delivery. You'll be waiting till eternity for your delivery.
